unnormalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum Across India**
normalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum Across India**

unnormalised: New Delhi: The nationwide smart meter deployment is picking up pace, with significant installations reported in Uttar Pradesh and Maharashtra. Energy Efficiency Services Limited (EESL) is actively involved in facilitating the transition, aiming to replace conventional meters with smart alternatives by 2025.
normalised: New Delhi: The nationwide smart meter deployment is picking up pace, with significant installations reported in Uttar Pradesh and Maharashtra. Energy Efficiency Services Limited (EESL) is actively involved in facilitating the transition, aiming to replace conventional meters with smart alternatives by two thousand and twenty five.

unnormalised: The initiative seeks to reduce AT&C (Aggregate Technical & Commercial) losses plaguing distribution companies (Discoms) and improve billing efficiency. Pilot projects in cities like Varanasi have already shown promising results, with preliminary data indicating a reduction in power theft. Consumers are expected to benefit from accurate billing and greater control over their energy consumption.

unnormalised: The Ministry of Power has set an ambitious target of installing 250 million smart meters across the country. Funding is being provided through a mix of central grants and state government initiatives. A recent workshop held on 20/10/2024 at the IIT-Delhi discussed further advancements in smart grid technology. The next review meeting is scheduled for 10:00 hrs on 15/11/2024. Concerns around data privacy and cybersecurity are being addressed through stringent protocols. On 01/01/2024, a new consumer awareness campaign was launched, featuring actress Madhuri Dixit, to promote the benefits of smart meters.
